alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 7:19PM CST until January 30 at 1:54AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Texas... Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River at Victoria. * WHEN...Until Monday night. * IMPACTS...At 28.8 feet, moderate flooding causes water to flow over Slayton Avenue and Memorial Drive, and starts flowing from the West Outfall toward Constitution and Craig Streets. Water is over Constitution and Craig Street and over areas west of Moody Street between Water and Constitution Streets. Water is also flowing over McCright and flowing into the golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Saturday, the stage was 28.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest at 28.7 feet tonight through Sunday and then begin to fall. The river is forecast to drop below flood stage Monday night. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 28.7 Sat 6 pm 28.6 22.9 11.4 9.0 8.4 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
